column3:
Changes look good, but haven't tested.

A small general comment though: why do you call your updates 'massive' :p
Seems I like that word and I call a pull massive when the changes are "big" ^^. I'm trying to reduce usage of "massive" :-D.\n
Did any coin control user review this?\n
Calling something "massive" doesn't help encouraging people to review it :)\n

I did massive testing and code review on this, changes look good to me.

Nit: The label "none" appears red, which is distracting. You could add a if dPriority > 0, so that the label appears black.
@cozz Updated to fix your nit :). And changed commit-message to remove `massive` :-P.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED BUILD/TEST, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/3380713af5f47efba48fcbd153013e57c9004ded for binaries and test log.

This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts (please tweak those patches in qa/pull-tes
ACK\nEdit: pulltester failure is #3445 again, can't be caused by the changes in this pull\n
I still don't really like that we're using a static "coinControl" object\n(not a comment on this code change)\n
Suggestion: factor out BitcoinAddress(text.toStdString()) and store it somewhere. It is repeated many times in the below code.\n
I added a variable for this, see updated code :).\n
